subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] how to name the letters
msgSnippet: ... Because it s useful to have a representation where letters are letters and punctuation is punctuation.  At any rate phonemic X-SAMPA transcriptions of
messageBody:
2013-04-23 05:19, Nathan Sharfi skrev:
> On Apr 22, 2013, at 6:18 AM, BPJ <bpj@...> wrote:
>> Nathan, if you are listening, I'd suggest adding a "broad
>> X-SAMPA" version avoiding non-letters like so:
>>
>> ROE = /r/
>> AT = /a/
>> UTTER = /V/
>> OWE = /oU/ ~ /Vu/
>>
> What's so bad about r\ , {, and @? I'm not exactly chomping at the bit to add another checkbox to the UI.

Because it's useful to have a representation where letters
are letters and punctuation is punctuation. At any rate
phonemic X-SAMPA transcriptions of English usually use /r/.

>> Moreover you might want to change the OWE transcription
>> to "/oU/ ~ /@U/" with the tilde outside the slashes,
>> since the tilde in X-SAMPA symbolizes (vowel)
>> nasalization, like in French.
>>
>
> Fixed. Thanks!
>
